title: Riot- Your Automated System is Broken- BRING BACK TRIBUNALS
body:
Everybody knows your automated system is garbage man.  You say right here..."The Instant Feedback System was developed by Riot Games so that players in the League of Legends community can dictate what conduct they consider inappropriate for a positive gameplay environment"

But then you literally have an algorithm sort through this crap, what, so some little troll and his 2-3 friends can decide they want to report someone and ruin the game for them?

Why did you ever get rid of tribunals in the first place? What's wrong with having actual PEOPLE, who can look at the circumstances surrounding the report, decide whether or not someone should actually get banned/suspended/restricted?  You literally say RIGHT THERE so that PLAYERS can dictate what conduct they consider inappropriate, and then you proceed to allow this kind of massive trolling.

There are COUNTLESS people ON THESE BOARDS who say things that are WAY more offensive than some of the stuff I see in game, and nobody cares? You put a language filter in a game, and then people literally have to watch what they say bc if they let something slip and upset the wrong people they can just get reported and your automated system will scan the chat, see the word(s), and ban them?  Like it literally makes ZERO sense.

replies.body: So you are saying that if I post the logs here from your most recent penalty (your 5th on this account) the community will vote to pardon you? Because I will, if that's what you're looking for.

Yes, I went on a tilt-spree a few weeks ago.

Yes, I got a 2-week suspension because of it.

Yes, I reformed...bc I didn't want to lose the hundreds/THOUSANDS of dollars worth of cool flare that I had.

> Again, doubtful, because everybody on these boards loves to flame and yell 'guilty' at people.

The huge majority of our players never get a single penalty .. ever. Of those that get 1, the majority never get another.

So, should I post the logs and get this tribunal thing started?

Because it has to do with the circumstances surrounding this issue?

You reset honor rewards, sure. Then I received the 2-week and was made dishonorable.  You have not reset them since then...so nice try, but no?  It DOES have to do with my behavior, because when you are dishonorable, the only way to get your rewards back is by showing reform, and being honored in your games.  So yeah, it does have a LOT to do with my recent behavior.

You seem to have an issue with the time-frame of all this...? I tilted, eventually got a 2-week...came back, reformed, brother snuck on accnt today, got trolled, cussed troll out, bot me perm banned.  I thought I made all of this stuff pretty clear?

Yes, I did. My behavior has changed since my 2-week was up. Fact. Check my game logs if you want. I've been positive, uplifting, etc. Just last night had a teammate THANK me in post-game lobby for staying positive and not flaming him. Said that I stopped him from tilting and just feeding all game.

You get to call me a general a--hole but all you know is out of context chat logs. You have no idea what was being said to me in pre-game, in-game, nothing.

In fact, you seem to be trying to manipulate my words in to something else completely. Seems odd to me that someone with such blatant bias is 'in charge' around here.

OT Hey Riot Tantram I know a guy who thinks Riot can detect genuine rage quitting through leaving an syntax of rage words, but I told him it's much more complicated then that but I lack the knowledge of player behavior stuff, can you explain to me so I can explain to him why it's not so simple. This was his exact quote
>they cant create a system to detect some one rage quiting when they flat out say they are rage quiting without out it punishing people unjustly then there is no way that they created a system that can punish people for toxicity without punishing people unjustly to say that which is what u said is just flat out mind blowing. most toxic words can be used sarcastically so if their system is good enough to tell when some one is joking around verse being toxic they 100% can create an easy system to punish people who say they are rage quitting. its a pretty easy system to create basically step one check if person said he was rage quitting step 2 did he leave? yes ban him very simple. that is 100% easier to make than an automatic system judging based off syntax if something was sarcastic or toxic.

It doesn't matter if people 'rage quit' or quit. A quitter affects the game in the same way; it still ruins the game for 9 other people. It really doesn't matter the reason why they did so. We have systems in place to deal with leavers.

Additionally, part of my point is that IF the tribunals were still around, that number wouldn't even BE 5...bc I VERY rarely flamed people for no reason at all.

I understand you guys promote the whole "be the bigger person" ideal, or whatever...but let's be honest here...people have bad days.

When tribunals were still around, I can remember getting in to trouble MAYBE once or twice...bc PEOPLE can SEE when players are antagonizing others, and they were understanding of that.

So, again..."The Instant Feedback System was developed by Riot Games so that players in the League of Legends community can dictate what conduct they consider inappropriate for a positive gameplay environment"

Apparently not.  All it's doing is making it easier for trolls to turn shit around on your 'normal' players by triggering them and then reporting them hoping something sticks. It's a joke man, really....Like I said, I have no idea what that dude was saying to my brother, but I doubt it was very friendly in order to have him raging like that.

In the interest of fairness, it should be noted that the Tribunal routinely chose to punish those who flamed *regardless of the reason for their flaming.* It's because of this trend that the current system works the way it does.

Sure, those players may have gotten punished by a lesser majority than those who were toxic without provocation, but the end judgement was the same in both cases.

Interesting that we have such differing experience with the tribunals.  I've been playing the game since 2009 and can honestly say that it has gotten ENORMOUSLY more 'sensitive' over the years...the things that I see people getting banned for now are downright ridiculous.

Like come on, it's the internet...who are you kidding?

Interesting to hear about the "the verdict" thread that you mention...I am unfamiliar?

My understanding is that once a perm ban is issues there is nothing that can be done...as such, I have to ask, are people actually able to get their perm bans overturned?

> [{quoted}](name=MrFeelg00d,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=LmUoMPb3,comment-id=000400040000000000000000,timestamp=2017-07-24T23:45:51.472+0000)I've been playing the game since 2009 and can honestly say that it has gotten ENORMOUSLY more 'sensitive' over the years...

I'd argue that it hasn't gotten more sensitive so much as more aware of the toxicity that is occurring. When you don't think there's much recourse it's easy to just shrug your shoulders and accept what's happening to you, but knowing that something CAN be done often makes people go "Hm. Maybe it's worth reporting this after all."

It's less about sensitivity, and more about what makes a welcoming gaming environment. My old metaphor of a bar comes into play here -- I'd rather go to a bar that lets me relax and hang out with friends than one that allows a stranger to come up, sit down, spill my beer, and tell me how much my family and I suck. The same is true of my gaming experience. It's not that I can't handle it -- it's that I don't want to HAVE to handle it.

> Like come on, it's the internet...who are you kidding?

See above. Anonymity is a hell of a drug, but that doesn't mean that a lack of civility and a recourse to insulting behavior should be the norm. I'm not one to preach about the need for monitoring all speech, but there should be some reasonable expectation of civility -- the people on the other end of the conversation, after all, are just ordinary people living their lives. No need to badmouth anyone.

> Interesting to hear about the "the verdict" thread that you mention...I am unfamiliar?

You can find the [original post here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/Pw3Ip6H2-introducing-the-verdict), and the others by looking up Ulanopo's post history.

> My understanding is that once a perm ban is issues there is nothing that can be done...as such, I have to ask, are people actually able to get their perm bans overturned?

Permanent bans -- due to the warnings given prior -- are only overturned if they are found to have been applied in error. If they are applied correctly (which they almost always are found to be) then they are indeed permanent.

But see, that's the problem man...it's also seen as "hey, if we make this guy mad enough...if we troll him hard enough...if I trigger him and make him say xyz, we can get him banned!!! HUEHUEHUEHUE!!!"

Also, if you think that the current state of this game makes it "welcoming" clearly you are missing the countless posts of people who are new around here and complaining about the toxicity of the game.

You're actually introducing MORE Toxic players TO the new players, because they just go remake their account and have to level it up again.

To dive in to your metaphor...what about the bar where the stranger comes up to grief you and your family, and someone else stands up for you only to be punished as well.  Would you go to THAT bar anymore?  Doubtful. I know I wouldn't, because why would I support a business who punished someone who was trying to help me?

I wasn't just talking about chat stuff, btw...You don't see the posts where people just suck at this game and get banned for int feeding?

How is that not ridiculous?  We claim to want to provide a nice and happy community, one that is welcoming, but we have people getting banned because they suck? Makes sense.  Overturned or not, it's still a huge inconvenience and annoyance, as well as a slap in the face from Riot. "Yeah, those toxic trolls were right to flame you, you suck at this game and were obviously intentionally feeding."

See, you and I are in agreement on just about everything, it seems...and I think that it's pretty obvious by the conversations here that I am not a 'bad guy,' nor am I a 'super toxic' player at all. I do my own thing, try to spread peace love and happiness and help people have a good time playing. Literally had a dude thank me for helping him not tilt last night...and now I'm perm banned because A) My little shit of a brother got on my accnt, and B) I was having a bad week and tilted a little bit?  Makes sense...not really, but sure.

Here is what I have learned from this.

Have a main account where you just /muteall as soon as you get in, bc there are toxic players in 3/4 games you play and if you respond to them with anything other than kindness, you WILL be punished....even if you've been playing for almost a decade with no issues.

Have an alt where you can go be toxic and get banned and not care, then make a new smurf and troll all the new players all the way back to 30.

All the while Riot can't figure out why they can't 'clean up their streets,' for lack of better phrasing.

> [{quoted}](name=MrFeelg00d,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=LmUoMPb3,comment-id=00040004000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-07-25T00:14:42.959+0000) But see, that's the problem man...it's also seen as "hey, if we make this guy mad enough...if we troll him hard enough...if I trigger him and make him say xyz, we can get him banned!!! HUEHUEHUEHUE!!!"

Yep. Some people will always try to do that. To some extent it's on YOU to know how to control yourself, be it disarming them through humor (I love doing that), muting them, ignoring them...anything but engaging them on their level.

> Also, if you think that the current state of this game makes it "welcoming" clearly you are missing the countless posts of people who are new around here and complaining about the toxicity of the game.
> 
> You're actually introducing MORE Toxic players TO the new players, because they just go remake their account and have to level it up again.

The new player experience needs improvement, yes. But it is more welcoming to me as an experienced player to know that toxic players will face punishment as a discouragement to prevent them from harassing me when I'm trying to just have fun.

Yes, there are some downsides -- I'll readily admit that.

> To dive in to your metaphor...what about the bar where the stranger comes up to grief you and your family, and someone else stands up for you only to be punished as well.  Would you go to THAT bar anymore?  Doubtful. I know I wouldn't, because why would I support a business who punished someone who was trying to help me?

Depends on how he does it. If he does so respectfully and is punished? No. But if he starts shouting and insulting THEIR family, he's nearly as bad. Remember -- it isn't "self defense" or "defending someone else" if the attack can be negated by something as simple as the mute button.

> I wasn't just talking about chat stuff, btw...You don't see the posts where people just suck at this game and get banned for int feeding?

In most of those cases I have to acknowledge that I do not have access to the entire game's data, while Riot does. They are, quite simply, more informed about what that player did than I can ever be short of seeing a replay.

> See, you and I are in agreement on just about everything, it seems...and I think that it's pretty obvious by the conversations here that I am not a 'bad guy,' nor am I a 'super toxic' player at all.

The former is obvious. The latter, however, is not. I don't mean that as a personal attack, but I know for a fact that several of my good friends (and great guys/gals ass) are completes ASSHOLE in *League*, to the point where I've had to shout at them over voice chat to stop typing. They're legitimately thoughtful, friendly, welcoming people -- but sometimes they just snap in very toxic ways.

In short, you can be a great person but a toxic player at the same time if you're bad at controlling your temper, and/or you default to certain types of language when annoyed.
